alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 7:33PM EST until December 19 at 3:21PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen and southeast New York, including the following county, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM EST, Gauge reports from the Mahwah River at Suffern continued to indicate minor flooding. Flood waters should recede late this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Airmont, Viola, Wesley Hills and Montebello. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
